name: FREESTYLE
about: The freestyle is the oldest method of moving forward through the water after styles similar to the breaststroke.

name: BACKSTROKE
about: Unlike the other three competitive swim strokes, the backstroke is the only one swum on your back.. This means that a good sense of direction is important as well as coordination.

name: BREASTSTROKE
about: The breaststroke is one of the most complicated strokes to learn. Technically speaking, it is completely different from all the others.

name: BUTTERFLY
about: The stroke gets its name from its sweeping arm action reminiscent of a butterflyâ€™s wings.

name: FREESTYLE ARMS
about: Swim freestyle using your arms only: keep your legs still (use a pullbuoy or pullkick as an aid).

name: FREESTYLE ARMS WITH A SWIM KEEL
about: The aim of using a Swim Keel is to keep your body aligned to eliminate any excessive sideways movement.

name: BACKSTROKE ARMS
about: Swim backstroke, using your arms only; keep your legs still (use a pullbuoy or pullkick as an aid).

name: BREASTSTROKE ARMS
about: Swim breaststroke using your arms only: keep your legs still (use a pullbuoy or pullkick as an aid).

name: BUTTERFLY ARMS
about: Swim the butterfly using your arms only: keep your legs still (use a pullbuoy or pullkick as an aid).

name: ONE-ARM FREESTYLE
about: Swim with one arm only keeping your other arm stretched out in front of you without moving.

name: ONE-ARM BACKSTROKE
about: Single-arm backstroke is an excellent drill for reducing resistance to forward motion in the water and making your arm stroke more efficient.

name: ONE-ARM BREASTSTROKE
about: This drill will help you improve your breaststroke arm stroke and make it more efficient.

name: ONE-ARM BUTTERFLY
about: Performing this drill regularly will allow you to improve your technique and swim properly even when you are tired.

name: FREESTYLE LEGS
about: Swim freestyle using your legs only, keeping your arms still and extended out in front of you with one hand on top of the other.

name: FREESTYLE LEGS WITH A KICKBOARD
about: Working with a Kickboard will allow you to focus on your legs to develop the muscles in your lower body and improve your leg kick technique.

name: BREASTSTROKE LEGS
about: Swim breaststroke using your legs only with your arms extended in front of you and one hand on top of the other.

name: BACKSTROKE LEGS
about: Lying on your back, relax your neck by looking upwards and swim using your legs only.

name: BUTTERFLY LEGS
about: Swim butterfly using your legs only with your arms extended in front of you and one hand on top of the other.

name: BACKSTROKE WITH HAND PADDLES
about: Swimming with Elite Hand Paddles will ensure you have the right backstroke arm technique, improving your control and power.

name: FREESTYLE WITH A DRAGSUIT
about: Improve your performance by increasing resistance during your swim trainings. Wearing a drag suit in the water will apply high resistance, but swim without forgetting proper swim technique.

name: FREESTYLE WITH HAND PADDLES
about: Swimming with Elite Hand Paddles will improve your control over your arm stroke and increase your power in the water.

name: FREESTYLE WITH A SWIM SNORKEL
about: A snorkel will help you improve your head position and develop a more efficient swim technique. Be careful not to tense your body or raise your head when using a snorkel to swim freestyle.
